Loved that there was no wait at 7pm (I realize this should have been my first clue but I was starving)!  Liked the chips and the 3 salsa platter.  Our waitress was nice but she did disappear for quite some time.  Disliked that our food came out wrong, charred and some things tasted as though they had been previously frozen.

great flan. I'd come back in just for flan, and maybe the guac.  come for the flandney brought me chips and salsa and bean dip right away, but I didn't see anyone after her gain for over 10 minutes, which I thought was odd, since the restaurant was not busy at all. I ordered the guac app, which took approximately 15 minutes to come out, and the bacon wrapped shrimp, which were another 5 minutes behind the guac. the red salsa was bland, and looked a bit more burnt than I like. the bean dip was good, but nothing special. the chips, unimpressive.my beans and rice... the rice tasted.like store bought, the beans were brought out on a separate plate and we're cold. the worst part though, was that even with as long as the shrimp took, they were painfully undercooked. the manager offered me a free dessert for the undercooked food, so I tried the flan, which admittedly was pretty good.  service 2/5 (slow though cheerful) food flavor 1/5 (guac was ok, bean dip ok) food temp 0/5 (cold food, undercooked food) value 1/5 I could say 0, but had the food been good, the value would have been decent.  I'm a guest of the hotel for 2 weeks, and I've stopped and looked at the menu several times but passed it by, worried the food wouldn't satisfy me. my meal ended up being comped, which was nice, but I think I'd still stay away from here next time. lovely restaurant, great vibe, but in the end, the food just wasn't good.

When I saw a prickly pear drink on the menu, I was sold! We stopped here en route to a comedy show at Access Showroom.  The bar also has gaming, so hopefully that drink would come with a big video poker win.  I love the name, I love the decor, loved the drink! Well, one of the drinks- the spicy margarita! Very good. Skip the prickly pear paloma, it was too sweet. My friend really was impressed with their White Russian, and thought it was a deal at $6.   For the main course, I had the chili relleno entree, which was a special request by me after seeing it mentioned on yelp. It was fine, but not great. The chips 'n salsa were pretty good, and theirs includes bean dip- always a great addtion to the meal. The decor is a bit upscale, with a centerpiece tequila bottle chandelier over the bar. I liked the gaming area at the bar and there are also seats available at the bar without machines. Nice place to stop before a show.

I really love this restaurant.  They have the best refried beans.  The shrimps taste sooooo delicious.  The enchiladas have a green sauce instead of red which is ok, I do prefer red though.  Service was great.  The margaritas were soooo delicious, don't miss their happy hour.  I also like that all restaurants at Aliante are never packed.  Wait time was under five to ten minutes.

So the four stars is because the kitchen got my order wrong but the 2 bartenders that were working the early dinner shift made sure it was made properly. Our waitress was a skinny tall c younger women who had a really unique name (sorry i cant remember) But she was lovely when  i came back in with my togo order as soon as she saw me she came to me and accommodated me. She had a good attitude. I love posole and there's was delicious I have now been back three times for it!!! so good soothes my cravings!!   Take outs are only at the bar and they do not let you call in your orders. which sucks for a local like me who doesn't want to sit down in the restaurant.

Came here for Taco Tuesday as they offer some of their tacos for $1.25. The tacos were decent, ordered carnitas and the meat was very tender and shredded. I ordered some alcoholic beverages as well, and went for the classic jack n coke. The chips, beans, and salsa was decent.  Service took quite a while, which negatively impacted my experience. I hardly saw my waiter and waited more than 45 minutes from ordering to finally receiving my food. Drinks were quickly given, though.  I'm not sure if I will come back again, as there are many other authentic Mexican restaurants in the valley that offer good quality and quick service.
